data.title: The Joys of Sharing Models on OpenCV's Modelplace
data.description: If we could all get together and share our model creation and deployments, that would be a very good thing for the computer vision community. Modelplace is a big step in that direction.

data.title: How to Train MobileNetV2 On a Custom Dataset
data.description: In this post, we will walk through how you can train MobileNetV2 to recognize image classification data for your custom use case.

data.title: Building vs. Buying a Computer Vision Platform
data.description: “You could do what Roboflow does yourself but…why would you?”-Jack Clark, Co-Founder of Anthropic, former Policy Directory at OpenAI,  It’s no secret that building a computer vision model on your own is hard work. data.title: How to Train with Microsoft Azure Custom Vision and Roboflow
data.description: Roboflow is a tool for building robust machine learning operations pipelines for computer vision: from collecting and organizing images, annotating, training, deploying, and creating active learning pipelines to rapidly create improved model performance. When it comes to the training step, developers should optimize for ease. Roboflow Train enables teams to

data.title: Your Comprehensive Guide to the YOLO Family of Models
data.description: The original YOLO (You Only Look Once) was written by Joseph Redmon and has produced a the best realtime object detectors in computer vision.

data.title: How to Train the Hugging Face Vision Transformer On a Custom Dataset
data.description: HuggingFace has recently published a Vision Transfomer model. In this post, we will walk through how you can train a Vision Transformer to recognize classification data for your custom use case. data.description: Each month, we publish a list of recent features and additions to the Roboflow suite of products. The previous month's update is here. data.title: What Does "End to End" Really Mean?
data.description: Developing, deploying and optimizing computer vision models used to be a cumbersome, painful process. With Roboflow, we sought to democratize this technology, which (first and foremost) meant knocking down the barriers that we perceived were preventing everyday people from exploring and implementing computer vision in their work and daily lives.

data.title: License Plate Detection and OCR on an NVIDIA Jetson
data.description: In this blog, we discuss how to train and deploy a custom license plate detection model to the NVIDIA Jetson. While we focus on the detection of license plates in particular, this guide also provides an end-to-end guide on deploying custom computer vision models to your NVIDIA Jetson on the edge.

data.title: Roboflow Competitors and Alternatives
data.description: We think it's important for users to make a fully informed decision, so we're committed to maintaining a comparison between our software and our competitors' so you can make the best purchasing decision for your business. data.title: What is a Cutout Augmentation and When Can it Help?
data.description: Applying data augmentations is one of the most essential steps when developing your dataset. Roboflow offers a wide variety of augmentations that you can apply to your dataset including an augmentation called the cutout augmentation. In this blog you will learn:  What cutout augmentations are When you should use cutout

data.title: Why Roboflow Train?

data.title: How Computer Vision Streamlines Risk Avoidance Workflows in Oil & Gas
data.description: The below is a guest post by Douglas Long, a full stack developer in Calgary, Canada. Douglas previously worked in oil and gas.  In the oil and gas industry, providing advanced notification for the development of energy infrastructure is a regulatory requirement. New pipelines can overlap with private landowner property.

data.title: Prompt Engineering: The Magic Words to using OpenAI's CLIP
data.description: Featuring rock, paper, scissors.  OpenAI's CLIP model (Contrastive Language-Image Pre-Training) is a powerful zero-shot classifier that leverages knowledge of the English language to classify images without having to be trained on any specific dataset. In other words, CLIP already knows a lot about the content of images without needing to

data.title: License Plate Detection and OCR using Roboflow Inference API
data.description: In this post, we’ll walk you through creating a license plate detection and OCR model using Roboflow that you can programmatically use for your own projects.

data.title: PP-YOLO Strikes Again - Record Object Detection at 68.9FPS
data.description: Object detection research is white hot! In the last year alone, we've seen the state of the art reached by YOLOv4, YOLOv5, PP-YOLO, and Scaled-YOLOv4. And now Baidu releases PP-YOLOv2, setting new heights in the object detection space.

data.title: How to Train and Deploy Custom Models to Your OAK
data.description: In this blog, we'll walk through the Roboflow custom model deployment process to the OAK and show just how seamless it can be.

data.title: The power of image augmentation: an experiment
data.description: One of the amazing things about computer vision is using existing images plus random changes to increase your effective sample size. data.description:
Roboflow eliminates boilerplate code when building object detection models. 

Get started with an example.

data.description: When creating computer vision models, data augmentation can improve model performance with an existing image dataset. data.title: Computer Vision is Shaking Up Brick-and-Mortar Retail
data.description: Computer vision is changing the landscape of retail storefronts. While it’s most often experienced in places like self-checkout lines, innovative retailers have realized the potential that computer vision can offer them by rolling it out to other functions within their stores.  The largest retail companies on the bleeding edge

data.title: Roboflow's new User Interface
data.description: When you log into your Roboflow account you'll notice a fresh look, but the features you know and love are all still just a click away. We've reorganized the app to make things easier to find, simpler to navigate, and primed for future enhancement. Video overview of our new UI.

data.title: Top 5 Ways Computer Vision Can Improve Online Shopping and Boost Revenue
data.description: Few things are as natural a fit as ecommerce and computer vision. With the bulk of online retail experiences being built on quality image data uploaded by both storefronts and customers, computer vision has the power to use all of that data to elevate the online shopping experience. data.title: Using Computer Vision to Keep Stock of Inventory
data.description: Many hospitals have an inefficient, analog way of managing their medical supplies. We used computer vision to dramatically improve how to track inventory.

data.title: How important is subject similarity  for transfer learning?
data.description: Using transfer learning to initialize your computer vision model from pre-trained weights rather than starting from scratch (initializing randomly) has been shown to increase performance and decrease training time. data.title: Our Favorite Computer Vision Courses
data.description: A question we frequently receive at Roboflow is, "What is the best class for learning computer vision?"  Like most questions, the answer does depend on your background and what you're aiming to learn.
